item.title: Trying to set up a counter = Blolean/int Troubles
item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

Ok i am trying to set up a counter for god wars. You kill a monster u get a point. and you need 10 points to use the portal.
i have these 4 ints
public int zammyKills = 0;
public int saraKills = 0;
public int armaKills = 0;
public int bandosKills = 0;
and i have it set up to were u kill npc XX get one point
but when i went to set a requirement on the portal i got this error

client.java:3720: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if (bandosKills = 10) ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

I used this code

case 8987: //Bandos Portal if (bandosKills = 10) teleportToX = 2850; teleportToY = 3680; sendMessage("You teleport to Bandos's General"); break;

How would i fix this??

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to set up a counter = Blolean/int Troubles
